Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and
your contract.

ALLEGATION:
Youth A had a verbal altercation with staff member which escalated. Staff began
cursing at Youth A and threatened him. Staff member flinched at Youth A at some
point during the argument.
INVESTIGATION:
This complaint was transferred for investigation by DHHS and the complaint noted
the following:
3

Youth A (16) is a juvenile delinquent that is currently placed at Highfields Inc.
Staff 1 is an employee at the facility. Yesterday, Youth A and Staff 1 had a verbal
altercation which escalated. Staff 1 began cursing at Youth A and threatened
Youth A stating, "I will fuck you up." Staff 1 also flinched at Youth A at some point
during the argument. Staff 1 was sent home and will not return pending an
investigation. Youth A and Staff 1 have not been around each other since the
incident. This is an isolated incident for both Staff 1 and Youth A.
I interviewed Youth A’s Worker via phone, on 09/08/20. The Worker reported that
she was aware of Youth A having behavioral issues over the weekend and another
incident today. The Worker provided some historical information on Youth A. The
Worker reported that she has been in touch with the facility during the time Youth A
has been placed there, which has only been a few weeks. The Worker reported no
concerns with the facility.
I interviewed the Chief Administrator (CA) at the facility on 09/09/20. The CA noted
that he reported these allegations after being notified by the Supervisor. The CA
verified the complaint information and provided Staff 2’s written statement. Staff 1
was removed from the schedule pending the investigation. The CA reported that
Staff 1 was on vacation out of town and his phone number was provided. The CA
noted that video review does not provide clarification as there is no audio. The CA
later confirmed via email that Staff 1 has no disciplinary action in his employee file.
I interviewed Youth A at the facility on 09/09/20. Youth A reported that he has been
at the program for about two or three weeks. When asked about this incident, Youth
A said that nothing happened. Youth A said that he and Staff 1 were arguing but
denied the Staff 1 threatened him. Youth A said he did not know why this was
reported. Youth A said he feels safe in this program and agreed that he would tell
someone if staff threatened him or used profanity toward him like in this allegation.
I interviewed Staff 2 at the facility, on 09/09/20. Staff 2 reviewed her incident
report/written statement and confirmed that she authored it. Staff 2 said that she
heard Staff 1 and Youth A get into an argument and it escalated when Youth A was
using Staff 1’s first name. Staff 2 reported that Staff 1 said, “my name is fucking Staff
1.” Staff 2 reported hearing Staff 1 say other things during this exchange, such as,
“fuck you,” “I’ll fuck you up right now,” and “bitch ass nigga.” Staff 2 stated that Youth
A was also using profanity with and toward Staff 1, but Staff 2 felt Youth A was
defending himself. Staff 2 said there was no physical contact between the two, but
worried that this situation was escalating. Staff 2 split up the two and directed Staff 2
to go to the office as the other kids in the unit began escalating and talking about
rioting. Staff 1 reportedly continued to try and engage Youth A after the incident and
Staff 2 redirected him. Staff 2 said that Staff 1 later left his shift after reporting he
was sick. Staff 2 reported that Staff 1 is usually not like this but has heard him swear
in front of the kids prior to this incident, but noted it was not like this incident. Staff 2
said that she notified the Supervisor after the shift.
4

I interviewed the Supervisor at the facility on 09/09/20. The Supervisor reported that
she was not in the unit when this incident occurred and noted that Staff 2 told her
after the shift was over. The Supervisor reported that she then told Staff 2 that Staff
2 should have notified the Supervisor when the incident occurred and not after the
shift was over. The Supervisor said that Staff 2 told her that Staff 1 was cursing
toward Youth A and also threatened to beat Youth A up. The Supervisor said that
Staff 1 contacted her during the shift and asked to leave work because he was sick.
The Supervisor said she never heard Staff 1 swear around kids before and was
shocked by this report. The Supervisor said that after she was advised of this, she
told her supervisor, who is the Chief Administrator, and directed Staff 2 to write up a
statement of what occurred.
I interviewed Youth B via phone on 09/24/20. Youth B reported that he recalled this
incident and remembered Youth A and Staff 1 arguing but did not know what it was
about. Youth B said that Staff 1 seemed intimidated by Youth A during the
altercation, but Youth B did not recall Staff 1 making any of the comments noted in
the allegations. Youth B said he was telling Youth A to calm down. Youth B denied
hearing Staff 1 threaten Youth A. After the incident, Youth B said that Staff 1 tried to
talk to Youth A but Youth A “was not trying to hear it.”
I interviewed Staff 1 on 09/25/20 via phone. Staff 1 reported that he recalled the
incident. Staff 1 said that the group had come inside the unit and he was getting
water for youth. Staff 1 said that Youth A was heard saying things like, “Staff 1, fuck
you,” and “I’ll beat your ass.” Staff 1 said that Youth A then came out of his room
without permission to get his own water and was confronted by Staff 1. Staff 1 said
that Youth A was using profanity and admitted to using profanity back at Youth A
during this incident. Staff 1 said that he said things like, “You’re not going to beat my
ass,” and “I’m not a bitch ass nigga.” Staff 1 denied threatening Youth A. Staff 1 said
that Youth A went back to his room and Staff 2 then talked to Staff 1. After a while
when the kids came back out of their rooms, Staff 2 said that he heard that Youth A
was plotting to get him fired and another youth told Youth A, “No, he’s cool.” Staff 1
said that he ended up leaving that day early from his shift due to having an upset
stomach and called in the following day because he was still feeling sick.
Documentation reviewed as part of this investigation is as follows with applicable
information noted:
 Incident Report/written statement, authored by Staff 2, dated 09/05/20. Report
was consistent with Staff 2’s interview.
 House Guidelines (A positive tone needs to be set by staff.)
 Employee policy for misconduct taken from the employee handbook (Actions
hostile and counterproductive to the standards of care, discipline, and
treatment, and counseling appropriate to Highfields; Conduct which could
negatively impact Highfields’ relationship with a customer, visitor, or fellow
employee; other violations)
 Employee handbook receipt form, signed by Staff 1, dated 06/10/20
5

APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.158 Discipline.
(2) An institution shall prohibit all cruel and severe discipline,
including any of the following:
(c) Verbal abuse, ridicule, or humiliation.
ANALYSIS: The facility is not compliant with the rule as Staff 1 admitted to
using profanity toward Youth A. This language is contradictory
to the facility’s policies and procedures, which call for a positive
tone from staff and for staff actions to be in line with the
treatment and counseling provided by the facility. Engaging in
the verbal altercation and using profanity only served to escalate
this situation and was not positive or productive.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on the findings of this investigation, I recommend no change to the current
license status. This recommendation is contingent on the facility submitting an
acceptable corrective action plan for the noted violation.
